topPRs.title: op-node: validate EIP-1559 params in derivation pipeline
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Adds redundant validation for EIP-1559 parameters (denominator and elasticity) in the derivation pipeline when processing `SystemConfigUpdateEIP1559Params` events. This provides defense-in-depth against the contract-level checks being accidentally removed.

The SystemConfig contract already enforces `denominator >= 1 && elasticity >= 1` at [L449](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/5401e3a46d4e193bbe5400b9c3948d8098c8692d/packages/contracts-bedrock/src/L1/SystemConfig.sol#L449), but this adds the same validation in the client-side derivation code.

**Validation logic:**
- Rejects params where denominator is 0 but elasticity is non-zero
- Rejects params where elasticity is 0 but denominator is non-zero  
- Allows (0,0) which is a valid special case that gets translated to pre-Holocene protocol constants downstream

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] Verify that `eip1559.DecodeHolocene1559Params` correctly decodes the 8-byte params from `params[24:32]` - the encoding is `uint256(_denominator) << 32 | uint64(_elasticity)` where denominator is first 4 bytes and elasticity is last 4 bytes
- [ ] Confirm the (0,0) case is intentionally valid - this matches behavior in `engine_consolidate.go` where 0,0 gets translated to pre-Holocene constants
- [ ] Run `go test -short ./op-node/rollup/derive/... -run TestProcessSystemConfigUpdateLogEvent -v` to verify tests pass

### Notes

Closes #18625

Link to Devin run: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/2349b811f31f4b039ac7cd25ae5db8ae
Requested by: Kelvin Fichter (@smartcontracts)
